page.title: 12LADY NANCE HAMLET
page.content: The buildings at Lady Nance,near Mountjoy are mainly made of elvan stone with slate rooves.These are locally quarried materials and are far more common than bricks in Cornwall, although nowadays concrete blocks are used on many new buildings in the Newquay area as they are relatively cheap and sand is easily available from the St.Austell china clay district.It is a waste product from the lucrative china clay business run by English China Clays. One permanent resident of the area said that he found it a peaceful place to live apart from the noise of aircraft flying to and from St.Mawgan airbase.It is a pleasant rural area of open fields with much wild animal and plant life.
